subject: Math
title: Factoring Quadratics - Complex Cases
description: Factor quadratics where a ≠ 1 and difference of squares

content.text: When the coefficient of x² is not 1, factoring becomes more challenging. We'll also learn special patterns like the difference of squares.

content.heading: Difference of Squares
content.text:
Special pattern: a² - b² = (a + b)(a - b)
Example: x² - 9 = (x + 3)(x - 3)
Note: Only works for subtraction, not addition!

content.heading: Factoring ax² + bx + c (a ≠ 1)
content.text: Method: Find two numbers that multiply to a×c and add to b, then split the middle term and factor by grouping.

content.heading: Example 1
solution: Recognize this as a difference of squares
Apply pattern: a² - b² = (a + b)(a - b)

content.heading: Example 2
solution: Find numbers that multiply to 2×3=6 and add to 7
